xmp_property.name: videoFrameSize
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoFrameSize_description=The frame size. For example: w:720, h: 480, unit:pixels
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoFrameSize_label=Video Frame Size

xmp_property.name: videoPixelDepth
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoPixelDepth_description=Size in bits of each color component of a pixel
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoPixelDepth_label=Video Pixel Depth

xmp_property.name: videoColorSpace
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoColorSpace_description=Example: sRGB, CCIR-601, CCIR-709, BT.709, V-Gamut, BT.2020 or Undefined
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoColorSpace_label=Video Color Space

xmp_property.name: videoAlphaPremultipleColor
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoAlphaPremultipleColor_description=A color in CMYK or RGB to be used as the pre-multiple color when alpha mode is pre-multiplied.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoAlphaPremultipleColor_label=Video Alpha Premultiple Color

xmp_property.name: gammaCurve
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/gammaCurve_description=Indicates the type of gamma curve. Example: CINELIKE_D.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/gammaCurve_label=Gamma Curve

xmp_property.name: whiteBalanceColorTemperature
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/whiteBalanceColorTemperature_description=Value of color temperature associated with white balance in Kelvin.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/whiteBalanceColorTemperature_label=WhiteBalanceColorTemperature

xmp_property.name: pullDown
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/pullDown_description=Sampling phase for film to video conversion, example: 3:2.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/pullDown_label=Pull Down

xmp_property.name: audioSampleRate
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/audioSampleRate_description=The audio sample rate. Can be any value, but commonly 32000, 41100, or 48000 Hz.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/audioSampleRate_label=Audio Sample Rate

xmp_property.name: speakerPlacement
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/speakerPlacement_description=Angle from center front, in degrees, example: Left = -30, Center = 0, Right = 30
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/speakerPlacement_label=Speaker Placement

xmp_property.name: fileDataRate
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/fileDataRate_description=The file data rate in megabytes per second. For example: "36/10" = 3.6 MB/sec
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/fileDataRate_label=File Data Rate

xmp_property.name: tapeName
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/tapeName_description=The name of the tape from which the clip was captured, as set during the capture process.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/tapeName_label=Tape Name

xmp_property.name: altTapeName
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/altTapeName_description=An alternative tape name, set via the project window or timecode dialog in Premiere. If an alternative name has been set and has not been reverted, that name is displayed.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/altTapeName_label=Alternate Tape Name

xmp_property.name: startTimecode
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/startTimecode_description=The timecode of the first frame of video in the file, as obtained from the device control.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/startTimecode_label=Start Timecode

xmp_property.name: altTimecode
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/altTimecode_description=A timecode set by the user. When specified, it is used instead of the startTimecode.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/altTimecode_label=Alternate Timecode

xmp_property.name: shotName
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/shotName_description=The name of the shot or take.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/shotName_label=Shot Name

xmp_property.name: contributedMedia
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/contributedMedia_description=List of all media used to create this media
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/contributedMedia_label=Contributed Media

xmp_property.name: absPeakAudioFilePath
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/absPeakAudioFilePath_description=The absolute path to the peak audio file.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/absPeakAudioFilePath_label=Absolute Peak Audio File Path

xmp_property.name: relativePeakAudioFilePath
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/relativePeakAudioFilePath_description=The relative path to the peak audio file.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/relativePeakAudioFilePath_label=Relative Peak Audio File Path

xmp_property.name: videoModDate
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoModDate_description=Date and time video was last modified
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/videoModDate_label=Video Modification Date

xmp_property.name: audioModDate
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/audioModDate_description=Date and time audio was last modified
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/audioModDate_label=Audio Modification Date

xmp_property.name: metadataModDate
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/metadataModDate_description=Date and time metadata was last modified
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/metadataModDate_label=Metadata Modification Date

xmp_property.name: artist
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/artist_description=The name of the artist or artists.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/artist_label=Artist

xmp_property.name: trackNumber
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/trackNumber_description=A numeric value indicating the order of the audio file within its original recording.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/trackNumber_label=Audio Track Number

xmp_property.name: releaseDate
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/releaseDate_description=When the recording was released to public
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/releaseDate_label=Release Date

xmp_property.name: discNumber
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/discNumber_description=If in a multi-disc set, might contain total number of discs; example: 2/3
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/discNumber_label=Disc Number

xmp_property.name: relativeTimestamp
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/relativeTimestamp_description=Start time of media inside the audio project
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/relativeTimestamp_label=Relative Timestamp

xmp_property.name: numberOfBeats
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/numberOfBeats_description=Number of beats in a music file or loop
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/numberOfBeats_label=Number of Beats

xmp_property.name: key
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/key_description=Key of the music; Example: C, C#, D
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/key_label=Root Note

xmp_property.name: scaleType
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/scaleType_description=Musical scale used in the music; Example: Major, Minor, Both, Neither.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/scaleType_label=Musical Scale Type

xmp_property.name: good
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/good_description=Preferred shots or takes are marked good.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/good_label=Good

xmp_property.name: cameraMove
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/cameraMove_description=Movement of the camera during the shot. Examples: pan left, dolly out.
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/cameraMove_label=Camera Move

xmp_property.name: shotSize
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/shotSize=The size, or scale or the shot framing
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/shotSize_label=Shot Size

xmp_property.name: cameraAngle
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/cameraAngle=Orientation of camera (angle) to subject in a static shot
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/cameraAngle_label=Camera Angle

xmp_property.name: shotDay
xmp_property.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/shotDay_description=The day or date in a multi-day shoot
xmp_property.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/shotDay_label=Day of Shoot

xmp_type.name: beatsplicestretch
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch_description=A set of parameters used when stretching audio using the Beat Splice stretch mode
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch_label=Beat Splice Stretch

xmp_field.name: useFileBeatsMarker
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch/useFileBeatsMarker_description=When true, the file's beat markers are used for stretching. Otherwise the rise and duration fields are used to automatically locate the beats.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch/useFileBeatsMarker_label=Use File Beats Marker

xmp_field.name: riseInDecibel
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch/riseInDecibel_description=Amount sound must increase in decibels (dB) to detect a beat
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch/riseInDecibel_label=Rise In Decibel

xmp_field.name: riseInTimeDuration
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch/riseInTimeDuration_description=Duration of time used to measure the decibel (dB) increase for locating beats
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/beatsplicestretch/riseInTimeDuration_label=Rise In Time Duration

xmp_type.name: projectlink
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/projectlink_description=Video file type and project file path
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/projectlink_label=Project Link

xmp_field.name: path
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/projectlink/path_description=File path of the project that created this media.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/projectlink/path_label=Path

xmp_type.name: media
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media_description=A reference to a media asset. This is typically a local file, but can be anything that can be specified with a URL. Contains information about usage in the parent media (typically a sequence), and the associated media rights.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media_label=Media

xmp_field.name: track
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media/track_description=Name or number of track containing this media
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media/track_label=Track

xmp_field.name: managed
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media/managed_description=When true, this is a rights-managed resource.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media/managed_label=Managed

xmp_field.name: webStatement
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media/webStatement_description=URL of web page describing ownership and/or rights for this media
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/media/webStatement_label=Web Copyright Statement

xmp_type.name: resamplestretch
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/resamplestretch_description=A set of parameters used when stretching audio using the Resample stretch mode
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/resamplestretch_label=Resample Stretch

xmp_type.name: time
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/time_description=A representation of a time value in seconds. This is similar to After Effect's TDB, or QuickTime's representation of time. They each have a value, and the scale of the value. For example, if the scale is the rational 1/25 (PAL 25fps), and the value is 50, the time is 2 seconds.
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/time_label=Time

xmp_field.name: value
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/time/value_description=The time value in the specified scale.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/time/value_label=Value

xmp_field.name: scale
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/time/scale_description=The scale for the time value. For NTSC, use 1001/30000, or the less accurate 100/2997. For PAL, use 1/25.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/time/scale_label=Scale

xmp_field.name: timeValue
xmp_field.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/timecode/timeValue_description=A time value in the specified format. Time values use a colon delimiter in all formats except 2997drop, which uses a semicolon. The four fields indicate hours, minutes, seconds, and frames: hh:mm:ss:ff The actual duration in seconds depends on the format.
xmp_field.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/timecode/timeValue_label=Time Value

xmp_type.name: timescalestretch
xmp_type.description: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/timescalestretch_description=A set of parameters used when stretching audio using the Time-Scale stretch mode
xmp_type.label: $$$/xmp/xmpDM/timescalestretch_label=Time Scale Stretch
